description.narrative: För att stimulera insatser inom den privata sektorn till utveckling och fattigdomsbekämpning. Denna Challenge Fond, för goda idéer, inbjuder företag att konkurrera om stöd på samma sätt som forskare söker medel från en forskningsstiftelse.

To encourage the private sectors’ contribution to development and poverty alleviation, Challenge Fund invites companies to compete for support for good ideas in the same way that researchers apply for funds from a research foundation.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The job creation has been high with 631 jobs reported as created and has exceeded (a low) target of 150 jobs by a factor of four. 4 of 5 calls for proposals have been processed, with between 300-700 applications per time. In total, 2074 applications have been submitted so far, of which 145 have been granted support. This shows that a large number of start-ups and SMEs with innovation potential has been stimulated by participating in this project. The spread geographically and among sectors is impressive and a very positive result. The Challenge to Change projects thus proves to be an effective way to achieve risk sharing funding for innovative and/or inclusive business. The largest proportion has been distributed to SMEs in the "Agricultural and food processing sector", 37 %, followed by "Other" with 21 % and "Clothing and Textile industry" with 12 %. This has also been a positive surprise in the project as there was concerns that the application system would give advantage to urban tech-savvy youth preliminary in the IT-sector, but this has proven not to be the case. The 5th Call for proposal was launched on February 10, 2020. Due to the corona pandemic and upon request from companies, the application deadline was extended by some weeks. These weeks turned out to be crucial as most applications were submitted after the initial deadline. The 5th call for proposal generated 500 proposal and 36 have been selected for contract. Contracts are expected to be signed in September 2020. The amount of own mobilized capital as per contract and reported by the project by end of 2019 is EUR 6.9 Million against a total grant amount of EUR 3.4 Million. This gives an average leverage of 200 % or twice as much as the minimum target of the project. The C2C funded projects has led to an average of 4.5 new full-time jobs. The project has also successfully contributed towards relevant crosscutting aspects including gender equality, environment, decent work and others. The recently conducted evaluation of the project states that cross-cutting issues did not receive sufficient attention during the 1st call for proposals but that attention to especially gender equality has improved significantly during successive calls for proposals. The project has succeeded in creating jobs for women and youth exceeding the set targets as 79 % of new jobs were youth and 61 % women which is way above the target of 40 % for women and youth. Other The audit for 2019 was good without major observations or recommendations given by Embassy Controller. The only comment was regarding issues with exchange rate which has been discussed and adjusted. The action plan for 2020 as well as reports for 2019 were submitted and discussed during annual review meeting held Mars 19th. Risk Register is ok.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
